summary: Sears, started in 1892 as a mail-order catalog, opened its first store in Chicago in 1925. It was the biggest retailer in the U.S. in the 1980s but fell to 31st by 2018. After years of sales drops, Sears' parent company went bankrupt in 2018. They planned to keep 425 stores, but by 2024, only 12 Sears stores remain in the U.S. and Puerto Rico.
title: Sears
